|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS |cpu1_type_rev = BMIPS3300 (R1) |cpu1spd = 200 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = Intel;JS28F160C3BD-70;JS28F160 C3BD70 A6217291; |flash1size = 2 |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 16 |ram1chip = Samsung;K4S281632I-UC75;619 K4S281632I-UC75; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |sw_cpu = true |wan_ports = 1 |wan_speed = 100MbE |lan_ports = 4 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |portbasedvlan = |802.1qvlan = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 00:16:B6, 00:18:39, 00:18:F8 |oui = 00:16:B6, 00:18:39, 00:18:F8 |bootwait = |stockbootloader = BSP;;; |stockos = VxWorks;;; |exp_if_types = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 12 |pwr_amp_dc = 0.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = |pwr_barrel_inner = |pwr_barrel_len = |pwr_pol = |serial = yes, 10-pin header, unpopulated, (115200 8N1) |jtag = yes, 12-pin header, unpopulated |specialfeat = |flags = |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bg |defaulip = 192.168.1.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = admin |defaultssid = linksys |defaultssid_regex = |default_ch = 6 |manuf = CyberTAN |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |tpfirmware = DD-WRT |availability = |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 04/03/2006 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1chip2 = Broadcom;BCM2050;BCM2050KMLG; |rad1_ant_conn = RP-TNC |rad1oui = |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |rad1correv = 9 |rad1cap = ap sta wet led wme 802.11d 802.11h rm cqa mbss4 afterburner acktiming }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== WRT54GS v6.0 serial numbers appear to begin with '''CGN9'''. {{seealso|Linksys WRT54GS series}} ==Links of Interest== *[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linksys_WRT54G_series WRT54G series on Wikipedia] *[http://www.dd-wrt.com/wiki/index.php/Linksys_WRT54G/GL/GS/GX Linksys WRT54Gxx page on the DD-WRT wiki] *[[dd-wrt-wiki:Version 5 And 6 Router Information|Version 5 And 6 Router Information]] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/wrt54gsv7-ds,7.pdf Datasheet.pdf] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/userguide/WRT54GS_UG_WEB_20070529.pdf User Guide.pdf] *[http://downloads.linksys.com/downloads/quickinstall/wrt54gs_qi_1.pdf Quick Install.pdf] ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} {{Dd-wrt54gs5-6 flash}} ==Upgrading== {{Upgrade dd-wrt}} ==Reverting== ===Reverting to OEM Firmware from DD-WRT=== To get back to VxWorks (default firmware) you need special instructions. http://www.bitsum.com/openwiking/owbase/ow.asp?WRT54G5%5FCFE#h13
http://www.scorpiontek.org/portal/content/view/31/36/ ==JTAG-Serial Info== ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== 
 nTRST   1o o2	GND
   TDI   3o o4	GND
   TDO   5o o6	GND
   TMS   7o o8	GND
   TCK   9o o10	GND
 nSRST  11o o12  N/C
'''Using [[WikiDevi:JTAG/TIAO/Universal JTAG User Manual (Parallel)|Universal JTAG Adapter]]''' 
 white    1o o2	 black
   red    3o o4	 GND
  blue    5o o6	 GND
 green    7o o8	 GND
 yelow    9o o10  GND
 orange  11o o12  N/C
* /noemw /nocwd switches required ====DD-WRT JTAG Recovery==== [[Project:JTAG|JTAG]]: # Backup CFE x2 (Compare the files, they must match exactly or there is something wrong with your JTAG setup) # Erase Wholeflash x2 # Flash CFE # Unplug Power # Unplug JTAG Cable [[Project:DD-WRT/TFTP flash#Linksys TFTP GUI|TFTP]]: # Set Rig ip static 192.168.1.10 # Plug network cable from rig to port 1 # Get TFTP ready, server ip - 192.168.1.1, Password - blank, file - [ftp://dd-wrt.com/others/eko/BrainSlayer-V24-preSP2/08-12-10-r14929/broadcom/dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin dd-wrt.v24_micro_generic.bin] # Plug in power # As soon as windows says "connected" hit upgrade. May have to use a network hub to make sure windows is always connected. # Hard Reset 30\30\30 ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== 
 VCC  1 o o 2  VCC
 TX1  3 o o 4  TX0
 RX1  5 o o 6  RX0
 N/C  7 o o 8  N/C
 GND  9 o o 10 GND
====DD-WRT Serial Recovery==== {{Modified redhawk0 instructions|wrt54gsv6}} ==vlan Info== ===DD-WRT vlan Info=== *[[Project:DD-WRT/VLAN Support]] Confirmed the WRT54GS v6.0 supports port-based vlans via the GUI and nvram with build 14853 micro-plus-SSH. WRT54GS v6.0's ports are mapped like this: 
 1 2 3 4 | case labels
 3 2 1 0 | nvram port numbers
====Defaults==== 
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.ports
vlan1ports=4 5
vlan0ports=3 2 1 0 5*
size: 17327 bytes (15441 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep port.vlans
port5vlans=0 1 16
port4vlans=0
port3vlans=0
port2vlans=0
port1vlans=0
port0vlans=1
size: 17327 bytes (15441 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.hwname
vlan1hwname=et0
vlan0hwname=et0
size: 17327 bytes (15441 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# lsmod
Module                  Size  Used by
ip_nat_pptp             2192   0 (unused)
ip_conntrack_pptp       2524   1
ip_nat_proto_gre        1552   0 (unused)
ip_conntrack_proto_gre    2312   0 [ip_nat_pptp ip_conntrack_pptp]
switch-robo             5036   0 (unused)
switch-core             5984   0 [switch-robo]
root@DD-WRT:~# ls /proc/switch
eth0
root@DD-WRT:~# cat /proc/switch/eth0/vlan/0/ports
0       1       2       3       5t*
root@DD-WRT:~# cat /proc/switch/eth0/vlan/1/ports
4       5t
root@DD-WRT:~# cat /proc/switch/eth0/vlan/2/ports
4
root@DD-WRT:~#
====Commands==== 
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram set vlan1ports="3 4 5"
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram set vlan0ports="2 1 0 5*"
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram commit
root@DD-WRT:~# reboot
====nvram==== 
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.ports
vlan0ports=2 1 0 5*
vlan1ports=3 4 5
size: 17433 bytes (15335 left)
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep port.vlans
port5vlans=0 1 16
port3vlans=0
port1vlans=0
port4vlans=0
size: 17433 bytes (15335 left)
port2vlans=0
port0vlans=1
root@DD-WRT:~# nvram show | grep vlan.hwname
vlan1hwname=et0
size: 17433 bytes (15335 left)
vlan0hwname=et0
root@DD-WRT:~#
